page.title: 08TRAVELLING IN RICHMOND
page.content: Richmond is a busy town which has many bus services, an underground station or tube station and a British Rail station. Business people commute into the city on both tube and trains and it takes about 20 minutes when the trains are running frequently. Later at night or at weekends trains and tubes are particularly useful because they run on their own rails and do not get caught up in the rush hour traffic jams, although early in the morning and between 4 and 6pm they are very crowded-you feel like a sardine packed in a tin. Most families in our area have cars and this makes parking difficult on Saturdays. Sometimes it is easier to take one of the many bus services which run into the town centre. Of course walking is also popular but few people walk far today because they are too lazy.
